clues.text: For a pre-funeral viewing, you may lie in repose; if your body is in the Capitol Rotunda, it's called doing this
The name of this funeral mass comes form a form of the Latin word for "rest"
In Poe's "Lenore" let this "funeral song be sung... for her, the doubly dead in that she died so young"
4-letter word for a stand or pedestal supporting a coffin at a funeral
"The Old Guard" or 3rd infantry, the oldest active U.S. Army regiment, serves as this type of "guard" at military funerals

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will be a word that comes [*] in the dictionary.)

clues.text: This word for noise from a storm ends with another sound you make with your hands
In this game colored disks are flipped into a cup
It's the "loyal" term for those who manage the operations of a school or other institution
10-letter border beyond which trees do not grow in polar areas
It's what the Brits call molasses
This British Airways plane cruised at 1,350 mph & in flight, would stretch 6-10 inches due to heating of the airframe
In 1967 this "directional" airline filed papers to serve Dallas, Houston & San Antonio
The name of this airline is translated from the Irish as "air fleet"
On Nov. 1, 1958 this airline began service from Amsterdam to Tokyo, flying over the North Pole
In 1932 the USSR Civil Air Fleet was given this shorter name; the airline still uses it today
In an 1819 tale this character awakens from a 2-decade nap to find his wife has passed on
Eliza escapes on the Underground Railroad & her husband George Harris later joins her in this 1852 novel
In this author's "The Portrait of a Lady", Isabel has her pick of men & marries Gilbert; things go... poorly
Dorothea & Tertius each get married in this really long George Eliot "Study of Provincial Life"; things go... poorly
Charles, a simple widower, marries Emma, this title Frenchwoman; things go... poorly
Yer pie hole, or the river's end flowing into the sea
A seasoning, or a term for an old sailor, matey
A European plant of the mustard family, or a shy person who stays on the side at a dance
A section of written work, or a voyage by water from one country to another
A martini-making accessory, or a member of a celibate religious group
From November 2007 to May 2011, Dominique Strauss-Kahn served the IMF as this, M.D. for short
M-D is manic depression, now called this disorder
MD is short for Maryland, whose state seal features the motto & arms of this family
MD can stand for this disease, of which Duchenne is the most common childhood form
For pianists, M.D. means use this
Local Reporting, 2012: the Patriot-News of this state capital for coverage of Penn State
Intl. Reporting, 2015: The New York Times staff, for "courageous front-line reporting" on this African epidemic
Photography, 1945: Joe Rosenthal, for this image of Marines doing this on Mount Suribachi
clues.response: the flag raising of Iwo Jima

clues.text: Editorial, 1929: The Norfolk Virginian-Pilot for "An Unspeakable Act of Savagery", about this form of race-based murder
Feature, 2016: The New Yorker's Kathryn Schulz, making Oregonians quake with a piece on the Cascadia this earth feature
His "Ropin' The Wind" was 1991's top album, remaining at No. 1 for 18 weeks
In 1978 this "Red-Headed Stranger" released "Stardust", an album of pop standards
In 1975 a double album was released combining 2 previous LPs featuring Johnny Cash at these 2 penitentiaries
In May 2005 she won "American Idol"; 6 months later, her debut album "Some Hearts" was released
This 2000 movie soundtrack album featured Alison Krauss on 3 tracks including "Down To The River To Pray"
Don't be this rude & unrefined person
Shake shake shake these spoils of war
The NCAA calls them "representatives of the institution's athletic interests"
Grant me this gift or favor
Named for a mathematician, it's the type of internet search using "and", "or" & "not"
He "Report"-ed, "There's an old saying about those who forget history. I don't remember it, but it's good"
"Lunacy packaged in pathos" was one description used of this late "Willy Wonka" comic actor
In "Coming to America", this actor has a simple request: "From this moment on, I command you not to obey me"
This standup who passed away in 2008: "No one can ever know for sure what a deserted area looks like"
His zany antics from movies like "The Bellboy" weren't on view when he co-starred with De Niro in "The King of Comedy"
Guys who can't wait to start firing idiomatically go in "with guns" this hot way
One hot summer day in 2016, the Boston Globe punningly wrote, "Gimme" this, a likely homage to the Stones
Meaning "caused by heat", it's found before "spring" or "underwear"
One of Dan Patrick's catchphrases at ESPN was this, Spanish for "on fire"
7-letter medical adjective that means "running a temperature"
After Rome burned, Nero shifted the blame from himself to this sect, making sport of them in the circus
Around 60 A.D. Nero gave his first public performance with this harp-like instrument
Having had enough of Nero's antics, this august political body decreed his death; he fled
At 16, Nero was proclaimed emperor by this military group, the household guard of the emperors
This statesman, tragedian & tutor to Nero was later forced by Nero to commit suicide

rounds.text: This famed musician disappeared on December 16, 1944 & was never found
